titleproper.value: Guide to the David Giannini Collection on Richard Hell and Genesis: Grasp <num>MSS.581</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-07-25T18:51:27</date>

unittitle.value: David Giannini Collection on Richard Hell and Genesis: Grasp

abstract.value: David Giannini is an American poet who has published more than 30 collections with small presses, and whose work has appeared in national and international literary magazines and anthologies. <emph render="italic">Opens</emph>, his first book of poetry, was published in 1971 by Genesis: Grasp Press, which he edited and co-founded in 1967. The David Giannini Collection on Richard Hell and Genesis: Grasp (dated 1968-1972) consists of correspondence between Richard Hell and Giannini, the majority of which consists of letters from Hell.

p.value: Identification of item, date; David Giannini Collection on Richard Hell and Genesis: Grasp; MSS 581; box number; folder number or item identifier; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.
Purchased from Granary Books in June 2019; the accession number associated with this gift is 2019.041.

David Giannini (born 1948) is an American poet who has published more than 30 collections with small presses, and whose work has appeared in national and international literary magazines and anthologies. <emph render="italic">Opens</emph>, his first book of poetry, was published in 1971 by Genesis: Grasp Press, which he edited and co-founded in 1967.

The David Giannini Collection on Richard Hell and Genesis: Grasp (dated 1968-1972) consists of correspondence between Richard Hell and David Giannini, an early collaborator on projects such as the poetry journal <emph render="italic">Genesis: Grasp</emph>. The majority of the collection consists of letters from Hell.

subject.value: Punk culture -- New York (State) -- New York
